author.name: Brother Arnulfus
author.description: A Benedictine monk who doth write devotional poems in Ænglish, praising God and the saints. His poems are often humorous, short, and satirical. They often contain metaphors of alcohol, especially wine or ale.

newsMedieval:
In oil markets, a sense, thou dost see,
A reticence, fearful of decree,
A goblet of gold, not yet full,
For the Fed's words weigh on the bull.

Sterling's strength, a Knight's firm steed,
May falter yet not recede,
A sturdy barrel of frothy ale,
MUFG prophesizeth not to fail.

Tito Jackson, singer of mirth,
At seventy, did resign his earth,
His songs, like wine doth to head,
Live on, though our dear friend is dead.

feedItems.title: Oil Markets Remain Cautious Ahead of Fed Decision
feedItems.description: Despite production halts in the Gulf of Mexico and disruptions in Libyan supplies adding to supply-side risks, front-month WTI prices still remain below the key threshold of $70 per barrel, reflecting traders’ cautiousness ahead of the FOMC meeting this week, Phillip Nova said.

feedItems.title: Sterling's Depreciation Potential Might Be Limited in Near Term
feedItems.description: Sterling has tended to weaken after recent BOE meetings, but any depreciation should be limited this time, MUFG said ahead of Thursday’s interest-rate decision.

feedItems.title: Tito Jackson Dies at 70
feedItems.description: The singer with the Jackson 5 topped the charts with hits including “ABC” and “I’ll Be There.”

author.name: Æthelred the Skald
author.description: A Norse poet who doth regale his audience with tales of gods and heroes, praising their might and prowess. He references Norse mythology and history in his poems. He is known for metaphors involving the sea and the weather and weaponry.

newsMedieval:
In the land of heat and desert's wrath,
QatarEnergy, they chose Saipem's path.
Shares did surge like a thunderous wave,
A contract won, fortunes to save.

Hark the news from ANZ's golden tower,
Metal's price blooms, like a sun-kissed flower.
In the shadow of the Fed's looming cut,
Gold gains ground; no door is shut.

Rexel, in its castle high,
QXO's billions it did decry.
Lead by Jacobs, of wealth untold,
Their offer spurned, deemed less than gold.

feedItems.title: Saipem Wins $4 Billion QatarEnergy Contract
feedItems.description: Saipem shares rose sharply after it was awarded an engineering, procurement and construction contract from QatarEnergy LNG.

feedItems.title: ANZ Raises Gold Price Forecast as Fed Prepares to Cut
feedItems.description: ANZ raised its short-term gold price forecast to $2,700/oz and the year-ending 2025 price forecast to $2,900/oz citing the U.S. rate-easing cycle likely to start this month as supporting prices.

feedItems.title: Rexel Rejects $9.6 Billion QXO Bid
feedItems.description: Rexel shares jumped after it rejected an offer from QXO, the U.S. company led by billionaire entrepreneur Brad Jacobs, saying the bid was well below its value.

author.name: Conchobar mac Dubhthach
author.description: An Irish bard of yore, who weaves dulcet melodies that capture hearts with tender love songs. With a quill dipped in courtly love, he pens metaphors of devotion, igniting the flames of passion in every soul who hears his verse.

newsMedieval:
On the morrow's break, Bunds stand unswayed,
Whilst the Fed's decree is yet to be played.
In the marketplace's perceptual glade,
A Commerzbank's foresight, keenly laid.

In the east, a pastor from the fray is hoist,
China’s grip uncoils, a choice voiced.
David Lin, aged three score and eight,
From wrongful detention, finds freedom’s gate.

In the land of the free, a danger struck,
An assassin's attempt, by fortune amuck.
Trump, untouched, the assailant swayed,
In the strong arm of justice, the villain laid.

feedItems.title: Bunds Expected to Stabilize as Fed's Rate Decision Awaited on Wednesday
feedItems.description: German Bunds are likely to stabilize at the start of the week as markets are looking ahead to the Fed’s rate decision on Wednesday, Commerzbank Research said.

feedItems.title: China Releases American Pastor After Nearly Two Decades
feedItems.description: David Lin, 68, was one of three U.S. citizens deemed to have been wrongfully detained by Beijing.

feedItems.title: Trump Safe After Another Apparent Assassination Attempt
feedItems.description: The gunman took off in a vehicle and is now in custody.

author.name: Guillemette de Ventadour
author.description: A whimsical troubadour from Occitania, who cherishes the company of nature's gentle creatures. She often includes metaphors of goats, dogs, rabbits, and snails in her poetry. Her writing style is terse.

newsMedieval:
Like the goat climbing high, lenders shares do surge,
In the market's wide field, where bounties do merge.
To stern India's delight, and the world's gaze and urge,
A new bloom sprouts, upon the financial verge. 

As the hound bares its teeth, young Routh made his claim,
Bound for Ukraine's tussle, in war's dire game.
His past tails him closely, like snail with its frame,
Seeking cause afar, aflame in fickle fame.

Crafty as the rabbit, in covert burrow deep,
Sinwar's messages coded, secrets they do keep.
Israel's hawk-eyed vigil, no fruit yet to reap,
Hamas's leader's life, safe beneath the heap.

feedItems.title: Bajaj Housing Finance Shares Surge After India's Biggest IPO This Year
feedItems.description: The mortgage lender’s shares surged on their debut, reaffirming growing investor enthusiasm for one of the best-performing stock markets in the world.

feedItems.title: Suspected Gunman Said He Was Willing to Fight and Die in Ukraine
feedItems.description: Ryan Routh has a lengthy police record and spent years trying to link himself to overseas causes.

feedItems.title: The Crude System of Coded Messages Keeping Hamas's Leader Alive
feedItems.description: Yahya Sinwar’s use low-tech communications has vexed Israel’s efforts to kill him.
